{{pp-blp|small=yes}} {{Use British English|date=October 2013}} {{Use dmy dates|date=January 2018}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Theo Walcott | image = Theo Walcott happy with his goal! 1 (16501335572).jpg | image_size = 200 | caption = Walcott playing for [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] in 2015 | fullname = Theo James Walcott{{cite web |url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/612828 |title=Updated squads for 2017/18 Premier League confirmed |publisher=Premier League |date=2 February 2018 |accessdate=11 February 2018}} | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1989|3|16|df=y}}{{cite web |url=https://www.11v11.com/players/theo-walcott-48916/ |title=Theo Walcott |website=11v11.com |publisher=AFS Enterprises |accessdate=18 August 2018}} | birth_place = [[Stanmore]], England | height = {{convert|1.76|m|order=flip}}{{cite web |url=https://uk.soccerway.com/players/theo-walcott/194/ |title=T. Walcott: Summary |website=Soccerway |publisher=Perform Group |accessdate=18 August 2018}} | position = [[Forward (association football)|Forward]] | currentclub = [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] | clubnumber = 11 | youthyears1 = 1999–2000 |youthclubs1 = [[A.F.C. Newbury|Newbury]] | youthyears2 = 2000 |youthclubs2 = [[Swindon Town F.C.|Swindon Town]] | youthyears3 = 2000–2005 |youthclubs3 = [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] | years1 = 2005–2006 |clubs1 = [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] |caps1 = 21 |goals1 = 4 | years2 = 2006–2018 |clubs2 = [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] |caps2 = 270 |goals2 = 65 | years3 = 2018– |clubs3 = [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] |caps3 = 41 |goals3 = 6 | nationalyears1 = 2004–2005|nationalteam1 = [[England national under-16 football team|England U16]]|nationalcaps1 = 4 |nationalgoals1 = 0 | nationalyears2 = 2005–2006|nationalteam2 = [[England national under-17 football team|England U17]]|nationalcaps2 = 14|nationalgoals2 = 5 | nationalyears3 = 2006 |nationalteam3 = [[England national under-19 football team|England U19]]|nationalcaps3 = 1 |nationalgoals3 = 1 | nationalyears4 = 2006–2010|nationalteam4 = [[England national under-21 football team|England U21]]|nationalcaps4 = 21|nationalgoals4 = 6 | nationalyears5 = 2006 |nationalteam5 = [[England national football B team|England B]] |nationalcaps5 = 1 |nationalgoals5 = 0 | nationalyears6 = 2006– |nationalteam6 = [[England national football team|England]] |nationalcaps6 = 47|nationalgoals6 = 8 | club-update = 13:27, 27 February 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 22:40, 5 September 2018 (UTC) }} '''Theo James Walcott''' (born 16 March 1989) is an English professional [[association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Forward (association football)|forward]] for {{English football updater|Everton}} club [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] and the [[England national football team|English national team]]. Walcott is a product of the [[Southampton F.C. Academy|Southampton Academy]] and started his career with [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] before joining [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] for £5 million in 2006. His speedy pace and ball crossing led his manager [[Arsène Wenger]] to deploy him on the [[Forward (association football)#Winger|wing]] for most of his career. Walcott has been played as a [[Striker (association football)|striker]] since the [[2012–13 Arsenal F.C. season|2012–13 season]] when he was Arsenal's top scorer,{{cite web|url=http://www.kickoff.co.uk/teams/?team_id=1&season=2012&area=squad|title=Arsenal Statistics 2012/13|publisher=KickOff.co.uk|access-date=30 October 2013|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131101190400/http://www.kickoff.co.uk/teams/?team_id=1&season=2012&area=squad|archive-date=1 November 2013|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}} and he has scored more than 100 goals for the club. On 30 May 2006, Walcott became England's youngest ever senior football player aged 17 years and 75 days.{{cite news |last=Wilson|first=Steve|title=The kids are alright: Football's youngest ever |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/3115222/The-kids-are-alright-Footballs-youngest-ever.html#|newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |location=London |accessdate=16 June 2012|date=1 October 2008}} In December, he received the [[BBC Young Sports Personality of the Year]] award. On 6 September 2008, he made his first competitive start in a [[2010 FIFA World Cup qualification|World Cup qualifier]] against [[Andorra national football team|Andorra]], and in the following match against [[Croatia national football team|Croatia]] on 10 September he opened his senior international goals tally and became the youngest player in history to score a [[hat-trick]] for England. He has represented England at the [[2006 FIFA World Cup|2006 World Cup]] and [[UEFA Euro 2012|Euro 2012]] and has 47 [[Cap (sport)|cap]]s, scoring eight goals.{{cite web|title=Theo Walcott|url=http://www.thefa.com/England/All-Teams/Players/W/Theo-Walcott |publisher=The Football Association |accessdate=1 February 2013}} ==Early life== Walcott was born to a black [[British Jamaican]] father and a white English mother.{{cite news | title= Don Walcott, father of Theo, is the British-born son of Jamaican parents |newspaper=Daily Express |location=London | url= http://www.dailyexpress.co.uk/posts/view/64555| date = 4 October 2008|accessdate=15 May 2010}} He grew up as a [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] fan due to his father's support of Liverpool. When Chelsea asked him to be a ball boy, he used the opportunity to meet his Liverpool idols:
"I was playing in a tournament for Swindon when Southampton and Chelsea showed an interest. Chelsea invited me to be a [[ball boy|ball-boy]] for a match against Liverpool and it was fantastic to meet my heroes [[Michael Owen]] and [[Robbie Fowler]]. I was a Liverpool fan simply because my dad followed them. Unfortunately I wasn't born when the team had their golden era, but I enjoyed watching the likes of Michael Owen, Robbie Fowler and [[Steve McManaman]] when I was growing up. When Liverpool won the Champions League last year,2005 I went mad. I was shouting so loud I think I woke up the entire village where I live!"{{cite web |url=http://www.liverpoolfc.com/news/latest-news/theo-walcott-why-i-m-a-liverpool-fan |date=20 June 2006 |title=Theo Walcott: Why I'm a Liverpool fan |publisher=Liverpool F.C. |accessdate=22 February 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140225104416/http://www.liverpoolfc.com/news/latest-news/theo-walcott-why-i-m-a-liverpool-fan |archivedate=25 February 2014 |df=dmy-all }}
==Club career== ===Early career=== Walcott was born in [[Stanmore]], London,{{cite book |editor-first=Barry J. |editor-last=Hugman |title=The PFA Footballers' Who's Who 2010–11 |year=2010 |publisher=Mainstream Publishing |location=Edinburgh |isbn=978-1-84596-601-0 |page=426}} but grew up in [[Compton, Berkshire|Compton]], Berkshire. He attended Compton Church of England Primary School and [[The Downs School, Compton|The Downs School]], playing football for the local village team and later for [[A.F.C. Newbury|Newbury]]. Walcott scored more than 100 goals in his one and only season for Newbury, before leaving there for [[Swindon Town F.C.|Swindon Town]].{{cite news | date=9 May 2006 | url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/topstories/tm_objectid=17050876&method=full&siteid=94762&headline=theo-lions-on-his-shirt--name_page.html |first=Martin |last=Fricker |author2=Robert Stansfield | title=Theo Lions on His Shirt | newspaper=Daily Mirror |location=London| accessdate=22 May 2006}} He spent only six months there before leaving for Southampton after he rejected a chance to join [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]].{{cite news |url=http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/sport/football/international/article4004073.ece |title=Theo Walcott sees action on two fronts in his national service |newspaper=The Times |location=London |author=Lansley, Peter |date=26 May 2008 |accessdate=29 July 2010 }} [[Nike, Inc.|Nike]] agreed to a sponsorship deal with Walcott when he was fourteen years old.{{cite news | date=10 January 2006| url=http://football.guardian.co.uk/News_Story/0,1563,1682874,00.html | title=Walcott spoilt for choice as Saints do their sums | newspaper=The Guardian | accessdate=7 July 2006 | location=London | first=Jeremy | last=Wilson}} ===Southampton=== In the [[2004–05 Southampton F.C. season|2004–05]] season, Walcott starred in the Southampton youth team that reached the final of the [[FA Youth Cup Final Squads#2004/05: Ipswich Town v. Southampton (1-0, 2-2)|FA Youth Cup]] against [[Ipswich Town F.C.|Ipswich Town]].{{cite news |url=http://www.dailyecho.co.uk/news/5551534.FA_YOUTH_CUP__SAINTS_2___IPSWICH_2/ |title=FA Youth Cup: Saints 2 – Ipswich 2 |newspaper=Daily Echo |location=Southampton |date=19 April 2005 |accessdate=27 April 2017}}
{{cite news |url=http://www.dailyecho.co.uk/news/5551226.FA_YOUTH_CUP_FINAL__IPSWICH_1___SAINTS_0/ |title=FA Youth Cup Final: Ipswich 1 – Saints 0 |newspaper=Daily Echo |location=Southampton |date=23 April 2005 |accessdate=27 April 2017}} In addition, he became the youngest person to play in the Southampton reserve team, at 15 years and 175 days, when he came off the bench against [[Watford F.C.|Watford]] in September 2004.{{cite web |url=http://www.saintsfc.co.uk/?page_id=3483 |title=Record breaker! |publisher=Southampton F.C. |date=8 December 2006 |accessdate=8 December 2006 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20071014111113/http://saintsfc.co.uk/?page_id=3483 |archivedate=14 October 2007 |deadurl=yes}} However, he did not play in the Premier League, and Southampton were relegated to the [[EFL Championship|Championship]] at the end of the 2004–05 season. Before the start of the [[2005–06 Southampton F.C. season|2005–06]] season, Walcott linked up with the first-team's tour of Scotland, just two weeks after leaving school.{{cite news |url=http://www.dailyecho.co.uk/news/5635618.Theo__16__can_break_Danny_s_Saints_record/ |title=Theo, 16, can break Danny's Saints record |newspaper=Daily Echo |location=Southampton |date=18 July 2005 |accessdate=27 April 2017}} He became the youngest-ever player with the Southampton first team, at 16 years and 143 days, after coming on as a substitute in Southampton's 0–0 draw at home to [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]] in the Championship.{{cite news |url=http://www.dailyecho.co.uk/news/5636530.Brilliant/ |title=Brilliant |newspaper=Daily Echo |location=Southampton |date=8 August 2005 |accessdate=27 April 2017}} Walcott made his full first-team debut away to [[Leeds United F.C.|Leeds United]] on 18 October 2005, and became Southampton's youngest senior goalscorer after 25 minutes of the 2–1 defeat.{{cite news |url=http://www.dailyecho.co.uk/news/5638766.Walcott_stars_but_there_s_no_easy_solution_to_Saints__woes/ |title=Walcott stars but there's no easy solution to Saints' woes |newspaper=Daily Echo |location=Southampton |date=19 October 2005 |accessdate=27 April 2017}} He scored again away at [[Millwall F.C.|Millwall]] four days later, and yet again in his full home debut against [[Stoke City F.C.|Stoke City]] the following Saturday.{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2005/oct/23/match.sport7 |title=Walcott eclipses Wise |first=Anna |last=Kessel |website=The Guardian |location=London |date=23 October 2005 |accessdate=27 April 2017}}{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/eng_div_1/4366862.stm |title=Southampton 2–0 Stoke |publisher=BBC Sport |date=29 October 2005 |accessdate=27 April 2017}} His rapid rise to fame also led him to be named amongst the top three finalists for the prestigious [[BBC Young Sports Personality of the Year]] award on 11 December 2005.{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/academy/4499096.stm |title=Three stars up for BBC award |publisher=BBC Sport |date=December 2005 |accessdate=27 April 2017}} ===Arsenal=== ====2005–06 season==== [[File:Theo Walcott 32.JPG|thumb|upright|Walcott playing for [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] in 2007]] Walcott transferred to Arsenal on 20 January 2006, for a fee of £5 million, rising to £12 million depending on appearances for club and country.{{cite news |url=http://soccernet.espn.go.com/news/story?id=355778&cc=5739 |title=Arsenal sign Southampton teenager Walcott |publisher=ESPN Soccernet |date=20 January 2006 |agency=Reuters}}{{cite web |url=http://www.saintsfc.co.uk/news/?page_id=6171 |title=Walcott goes |publisher=Southampton F.C. |date=20 January 2006 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070926222625/http://www.saintsfc.co.uk/news/?page_id=6171 |archivedate=26 September 2007 |deadurl=yes}} The original fee, payable by instalments reported in ''[[The Times]]'' as £5 million down, five increments of £1 million to be paid after each set of ten Premier League appearances, and £2 million in "bonus payments",{{cite news |title=A bargain buy or expensive flop? Only time will tell |first=Matt |last=Hughes |newspaper=The Times |location=London |date=21 January 2006 |page=102}} was revised down to £9.1 million in a compromise settlement agreed in March 2008.{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/2296011/Southampton-lose-2.9m-over-Theo-Walcott.html |title=Southampton lose £2.9m over Theo Walcott |first=Jeremy |last=Wilson |newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |location=London |date=1 April 2008 |accessdate=22 February 2014}} Walcott initially joined as a scholar, having agreed to sign a professional contract on his 17th birthday on 16 March 2006. In September 2008, manager [[Arsène Wenger]] confirmed that [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]], Chelsea and Liverpool had all been interested in signing him.{{cite web |url=http://www.arsenal.com/news/news-archive/wenger-the-day-i-knew-i-wanted-walcott |title=Wenger – The day I knew I wanted Walcott |first=Declan |last=Taylor |date=12 September 2008 |accessdate=28 April 2017 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131023161533/http://www.arsenal.com/news/news-archive/wenger-the-day-i-knew-i-wanted-walcott |archivedate=23 October 2013 |df=dmy-all }} ====2006–07 season==== Walcott made his [[Premier League]] debut on 19 August 2006, the first day of the [[2006–07 FA Premier League|2006–07 season]], coming on as a substitute against [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]] and setting up a goal for [[Gilberto Silva]].{{cite news |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/arsenal-1-aston-villa-1-walcott-the-wonderkid-the-new-home-hero-412657.html |title=Arsenal 1 Aston Villa 1: Walcott the wonderkid the new home hero |first=Steve |last=Tongue |newspaper=The Independent |location=London |date=20 August 2006 |accessdate=27 April 2017}} His next appearance was four days later in the [[UEFA Champions League|Champions League]], in the second leg of Arsenal's third qualifying round match against [[GNK Dinamo Zagreb|Dinamo Zagreb]]; he became the youngest ever Arsenal player to appear in European competition, a record since beaten by [[Jack Wilshere]].{{cite web |url=http://www.arsenal.com/news/news-archive/wilshere-becomes-youngest-european-gunner |title=Wilshere is youngest European Gunner |publisher=Arsenal F.C. |date=25 November 2008 |accessdate=30 June 2009}} Within minutes of coming on, Walcott received his first [[Yellow card (sports)|yellow card]] in Arsenal colours for taking a shot several seconds after the referee had already blown for [[Offside (association football)|offside]].{{cite web |url=http://www.arsenalnewsreview.co.uk/without-thierry-it/ |title=Without Thierry, it's Hamlet without the prince |first=Myles |last=Palmer |website=Arsenal News Review |date=24 August 2006 |accessdate=27 April 2017}} During stoppage time, his cross beat the Dinamo defence and [[Mathieu Flamini]] scored, giving Arsenal a 2–1 win, their first in the new [[Emirates Stadium]], and giving Walcott his second [[assist (association football)|assist]] in two substitute appearances.{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/2344072/Walcott-the-catalyst-for-Arsenal-revival.html |title=Walcott the catalyst for Arsenal revival |first=John |last=Ley |newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |location=London |date=24 August 2006 |accessdate=28 April 2017}} His first start came in a home league match against Watford on 14 October 2006.{{cite news |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/arsenal-3-watford-0-walcott-gifts-his-manager-real-presence-6230982.html |title=Arsenal 3 Watford 0: Walcott gifts his manager real presence |first=Tim |last=Collings |newspaper=The Independent |location=London |date=15 October 2006 |accessdate=27 April 2017}} Walcott's exploits with Arsenal and [[England national football team|England]] earned him the BBC Young Sports Personality of the Year award at the end of 2006.{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/cbbcnews/hi/newsid_6110000/newsid_6113600/6113694.stm |title=Walcott wins Young Sports award |publisher=CBBC Newsround |date=10 December 2006 |accessdate=15 June 2016}} [[File:Theo Walcott 3.jpg|thumb|left|upright|Walcott warming up with Arsenal in 2007]] Walcott's first goal for Arsenal came in the [[2007 Football League Cup Final|2007 League Cup Final]] against Chelsea at the [[Millennium Stadium]], [[Cardiff]], on 25 February 2007. His 12th-minute strike was overshadowed by events later on in the match: [[John Terry]] was knocked unconscious, [[Didier Drogba]] scored twice to give Chelsea a 2–1 victory and three players were [[Red card (sports)|sent off]] following a mass brawl.{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/league_cup/6371613.stm |title=Chelsea 2–1 Arsenal |publisher=BBC Sport |date=25 February 2007 |accessdate=8 December 2017}} A persistent shoulder injury limited his performance, and Arsène Wenger said that after the injury, he was "he was 50 per cent of what he was before."{{cite web |url=http://www.arsenal.com/first-team/players/theo-walcott/biography |title=Player profile: Theo Walcott: Biography |publisher=Arsenal F.C. |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130116021238/http://www.arsenal.com/first-team/players/theo-walcott/biography |archivedate=16 January 2013 |deadurl=yes}} ====2007–08 season==== Walcott's first home goals of the [[2007–08 Arsenal F.C. season|2007–08 season]] were scored in a [[2007–08 UEFA Champions League|Champions League]] match against [[Slavia Prague]], which Arsenal won 7–0; he also set up a goal for [[Cesc Fàbregas]].{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/europe/7054216.stm |title=Arsenal 7–0 Slavia Prague |publisher=BBC Sport |first=Caroline |last=Cheese |date=23 October 2007 |accessdate=10 November 2008}} Walcott scored his first two Premier League goals in a 2–2 draw with [[Birmingham City F.C.|Birmingham City]] at [[St Andrew's (stadium)|St Andrew's]] on 23 February 2008.{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_prem/7248309.stm |title=Birmingham 2–2 Arsenal |first=Saj |last=Chowdhury |publisher=BBC Sport |date=23 February 2008 |accessdate=24 February 2008}} In the Champions League quarter-final on 8 April, Walcott "beat six Liverpool defenders during a magical run from inside his own half before squaring for [Emmanuel] [[Emmanuel Adebayor|Adebayor]] to sidefoot home" for a late equaliser, but Liverpool scored twice more to take the match 4–2 and the tie 5–3 on aggregate.{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/europe/7332209.stm |title=Liverpool 4–2 Arsenal (agg 5–3) |first=Andrew |last=McKenzie |publisher=BBC Sport |date=8 April 2008 |accessdate=28 April 2017}} A couple of weeks later, Wenger claimed that Walcott had made the shift from boy to man, but was not yet a monster.{{cite web |url=http://www.arsenal.com/news/news-archive/wenger-walcott-is-a-man-but-not-a-monster |title=Wenger – Walcott is a man but not a monster |publisher=Arsenal F.C. |date=21 April 2008 |accessdate=28 April 2017 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160125070257/http://www.arsenal.com/news/news-archive/wenger-walcott-is-a-man-but-not-a-monster |archivedate=25 January 2016 |df=dmy-all }} He finished the season with seven goals in all competitions and four in the league. ====2008–09 season==== For the [[2008–09 Arsenal F.C. season|2008–09 season]], Walcott changed his shirt number from 32 to 14, as previously worn by his idol, [[Thierry Henry]]. He had wanted number 8, but that had already been taken by [[Samir Nasri]].{{cite web |url=http://www.arsenal.com/news/news-archive/walcott-no-14-was-my-second-choice-shirt |title=Walcott: No 14 was my second-choice shirt |first=Richard |last=Clarke |publisher=Arsenal F.C. |date=7 August 2008 |accessdate=28 April 2017 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160317221950/http://www.arsenal.com/news/news-archive/walcott-no-14-was-my-second-choice-shirt |archivedate=17 March 2016 |df=dmy-all }} He established himself as a first-team regular, starting many matches on the right of midfield or on the wing.{{citation needed|date=April 2017}} On 18 October, Walcott scored his first Premier League goal of the season, Arsenal's third as they came back from 1–0 down to beat [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] 3–1. Three days later, he scored Arsenal's second in a 5–2 win away to [[Fenerbahçe S.K.|Fenerbahçe]] in the [[2008–09 UEFA Champions League|2008–09 Champions League]], rounding the goalkeeper before finishing from a tight angle.{{cite news |url=http://www.belfasttelegraph.co.uk/sport/football/european/arsenal-young-guns-stun-turks-28451241.html |title=Arsenal young guns stun Turks |newspaper=Belfast Telegraph |date=21 October 2008 |accessdate=28 April 2017}} Walcott dislocated his right shoulder in November while training with England for a friendly against [[Germany national football team|Germany]].{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/internationals/7736641.stm |title=Walcott ruled out after surgery |publisher=BBC Sport |date=20 November 2008 |accessdate=14 May 2009}} He underwent surgery to correct a hereditary weakness, and returned to action in March, but at the end of the season he still felt that it was hampering his performance.{{cite news |url=https://www.standard.co.uk/sport/theo-walcott-i-am-still-fighting-to-forget-my-shoulder-fears-6759543.html |title=Theo Walcott: I am still fighting to forget my shoulder fears |first1=James |last1=Olley |first2=Simon |last2=Johnson |newspaper=London Evening Standard |date=12 May 2009 |accessdate=28 April 2017}} In April 2009, he scored against [[Wigan Athletic F.C.|Wigan Athletic]], before, four days later in the Champions League quarter-final second leg, he gave his team a 10th-minute lead against [[Villarreal C.F.|Villarreal]] after receiving a pass from Fàbregas and flicking the ball over the goalkeeper. Arsenal won 4–1 on aggregate.{{cite web |url=http://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/season=2009/matches/round=15278/match=302807/postmatch/report/index.html |title=On-fire Gunners shoot down Villarreal |first=Andrew |last=Haslam |publisher=UEFA |date=15 April 2009 |accessdate=22 February 2014}} In the next match, an [[2008–09 FA Cup|FA Cup]] semi-final against Chelsea, Walcott put Arsenal ahead in the first half, although they eventually lost 2–1. Three days later, Walcott came off to the bench to run half the length of the field before squaring for [[Andrey Arshavin]] to put Arsenal 4–3 up against Liverpool in the 90th minute; the match finished 4–4.{{cite news |url=http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/liverpool-fc-v-arsenal-five-10723673 |title=Liverpool FC v Arsenal: Five memorable Anfield clashes from down the years |first=Neil |last=Jones |newspaper=Liverpool Echo |date=13 January 2016 |accessdate=28 April 2017}} In May 2009 he signed a new long-term contract with Arsenal.{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/leagues/premierleague/arsenal/5295079/Theo-Walcott-signs-new-Arsenal-contract.html |title=Theo Walcott signs new Arsenal contract |first=Jeremy |last=Wilson |newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |location=London |date=8 May 2009 |accessdate=30 May 2010}} ====2009–10 season==== [[File:Theo-Walcott Emirates Cup 2010-cropped.jpg|thumb|upright|Walcott playing for Arsenal in 2010]] Walcott's [[2009–10 Arsenal F.C. season|2009–10 season]] was marred by injury: he made only 15 starts in all competitions.{{cite web |url=http://origin-www.premierleague.com/page/Headlines/0,,12306~2063032,00.html |title=Walcott axed from England squad |publisher=Premier League |accessdate=22 February 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140226185633/http://origin-www.premierleague.com/page/Headlines/0,,12306~2063032,00.html |archivedate=26 February 2014 |df=dmy-all }} Problems with lower back, knee and hamstring meant he did not play a full 90 minutes until 9 December, against [[Olympiacos F.C.|Olympiacos]] in the Champions League, as Arsenal, already qualified for the knockout stages, fielded the youngest team ever to start a match in that competition.{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2009/dec/11/theo-walcott-arsenal-carlos-vela |title=Theo Walcott claims he is not an injury-prone player, just unlucky |first=David |last=Hytner |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London |date=11 December 2009 |accessdate=28 April 2017}}
{{cite web |url=http://www.arsenal.com/match/report/0910/post/first-team/olympiacos-1-0-arsenal-match-report |title=Olympiacos 1–0 Arsenal |first=Richard |last=Clarke |publisher=Arsenal F.C. |date=9 December 2009 |accessdate=28 April 2017}} On 6 March 2010, Walcott scored his second goal of the season against [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]] in a 3–1 victory to give Arsenal a decisive lead, with a left-footed effort from the edge of the box, after cutting inside from the right flank.{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2010/mar/08/arsenal-burnley-premier-league |title=Arsenal's Theo Walcott answers critics with display of brainpower |first=David |last=Hytner |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London |date=8 March 2010 |accessdate=30 May 2010}} For the first hour of the Champions League quarter-final first leg, Arsenal were outclassed by [[FC Barcelona|Barcelona]], although only two goals behind. Walcott's appearance off the bench was the turning point. He scored within three minutes of entering the match, "brought speed and fearlessness to the hosts' attacks", and was involved in the move that led to Fàbregas' equaliser from the [[Penalty kick (association football)|penalty spot]].{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/arsenal/7541802/Arsenal-2-Barcelona-2-match-report.html |title=Arsenal 2 Barcelona 2: match report |first=Henry |last=Winter |newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |location=London |date=1 April 2010 |accessdate=28 April 2017}} After much debate,{{citation needed|date=April 2017}} Wenger reacted to Walcott's performance by starting him in the second leg. According to BBC Sport's match report, Barcelona manager [[Pep Guardiola]] "anticipated his inclusion by bringing in the pacy [[Eric Abidal]]" to mark him, and Walcott's main contribution was to set up [[Nicklas Bendtner]]'s opening goal in a 4–1 defeat.{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/europe/8602344.stm |title=Barcelona 4–1 Arsenal (agg 6–3) |first=Stuart |last=Roach |publisher=BBC Sport |date=6 April 2010 |accessdate=29 May 2017}} ====2010–11 season==== Walcott's start to the [[2010–11 Arsenal F.C. season|2010–11 season]] was particularly successful, winning Arsenal's Player of the Month vote in August by a landslide.{{cite web |url=http://www.arsenal.com/news/news-archive/walcott-is-ea-sports-player-of-the-month |title=Walcott is EA SPORTS Player of the Month |publisher=Arsenal F.C. |date=11 September 2010 |accessdate=2 November 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100910020103/http://www.arsenal.com/news/news-archive/walcott-is-ea-sports-player-of-the-month |archivedate=10 September 2010 |df=dmy-all }} In the second match of the [[2010–11 Premier League|new Premier League season]], Walcott scored the first [[hat-trick (association football)|hat-trick]] of his club career as Arsenal beat newly promoted [[Blackpool F.C.|Blackpool]] 6–0.{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_prem/8925678.stm |title=Arsenal 6–0 Blackpool |first=David |last=Ornstein |publisher=BBC Sport |date=21 August 2010 |accessdate=29 May 2017}} On 27 December 2010, he scored a goal and made an assist to help beat Chelsea 3–1 in what Arsène Wenger dubbed a "must-win" match.{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_prem/9309539.stm |title=Arsenal 3–1 Chelsea |first=Phil |last=McNulty |publisher=BBC Sport |date=27 December 2010 |accessdate=27 December 2010}}{{cite news |url=http://www.skysports.com/story/0,19528,11670_6611242,00.html |title=Wenger – We must beat Chelsea |first=Ben |last=Collins |publisher=Sky Sports |date=27 December 2010 |accessdate=27 December 2010}} Interviewed after Arsenal's [[2010–11 FA Cup|FA Cup]] third-round tie against Leeds United in January 2011, Walcott admitted [[diving (association football)|diving]] in the last minute of the match in an unsuccessful attempt to win a penalty kick. He was fouled soon afterwards, legitimately winning a penalty which was converted by Fàbregas to secure a draw and a [[Replay (sports)|replay]] of the fixture{{cite news |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11670/6646841/walcott-says-sorry-for-dive |title=Walcott says sorry for dive |publisher=Sky Sports |date=8 January 2011 |accessdate=29 May 2017}}{{snd}}which Arsenal won.{{cite news |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/13865/6676040/gunners-down-brave-leeds |title=Gunners down brave Leeds |publisher=Sky Sports |date=19 January 2011 |accessdate=29 May 2017}} On 21 February, during the 1–0 victory against Stoke City, Walcott caught his studs in the turf, sustaining an ankle injury that ruled him out of the [[2011 Football League Cup Final|League Cup final]] and the [[2010–11 UEFA Champions League knockout phase#Round of 16|Champions League last-16 second leg]] against Barcelona.{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/arsenal/8344252/Arsenals-Theo-Walcott-ruled-out-of-Carling-Cup-final-against-Birmingham-and-Cesc-Fabregas-doubtful.html |title=Arsenal's Theo Walcott ruled out of Carling Cup final against Birmingham and Cesc Fabregas doubtful |first=Jeremy |last=Wilson |newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |location=London |date=23 February 2011 |accessdate=29 May 2017}}
{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/arsenal/8382165/Theo-Walcotts-delayed-recovery-adds-further-to-Arsenals-injury-woes-and-is-a-worry-for-England.html |title=Theo Walcott's delayed recovery adds further to Arsenal's injury woes, and is a worry for England |first=Jeremy |last=Wilson |newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |location=London |date=14 March 2011 |accessdate=29 May 2017}} On the last day of the season, he came off the bench to score the equaliser in a 2–2 draw away to Fulham,{{cite news |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/fulham-vs-arsenal/215187 |title=All square at the Cottage |first=Jamie |last=Casey |publisher=Sky Sports |date=22 May 2011 |accessdate=29 May 2017}} and ended up with a then career high of 9 goals in the Premier League and 13 in all competitions. ====2011–12 season==== [[File:Theo Walcott Leon Britton Neil Taylor.jpg|thumb|upright|Walcott (right) playing for Arsenal in 2011]] On 16 August, Walcott scored his first goal of the season in the first leg of a [[2011–12 UEFA Champions League|Champions League]] qualifying match against [[Udinese Calcio|Udinese]], giving a vital 1–0 win to Arsenal to carry on into the second leg of the tie.{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/14457248.stm |title=Arsenal 1–0 Udinese |publisher=BBC Sport |date=16 August 2011 |accessdate=31 October 2011|first=Phil|last=McNulty}} Walcott scored again in the second leg as Arsenal came from behind to win 2–1 and 3–1 on aggregate which helped Arsenal secure qualification for the lucrative group stage of the competition for the 14th straight season.{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/14569531.stm |title=Udinese 1–2 Arsenal (agg 1–3)|publisher=BBC Sport |date=24 August 2011 |accessdate=31 October 2011| first=David| last=Ornstein}} Walcott scored Arsenal's first goal in the [[2011–12 Premier League]] campaign against [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] though this was a mere consolation as Arsenal lost 8–2.{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/14606020.stm|title=Man Utd 8 – 2 Arsenal|publisher=BBC Sport|date=28 August 2011|accessdate=31 October 2011|first=Phil|last=McNulty}} He netted his fourth goal on 29 October in a 5–3 win at Chelsea where he picked up the ball on the wing, slipped, then got up and jinked past two Chelsea players before scoring.{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/15413593.stm|title=Chelsea 3–5 Arsenal|publisher=BBC Sport|date= 29 October 2011|accessdate=31 October 2011}} Walcott scored his first goal of 2012 in the 3–2 defeat at [[Swansea City A.F.C.|Swansea City]], chipping the ball over Swans goalkeeper [[Michel Vorm]].{{cite news|last=Henson|first=Mike|title=Swansea 3–2 Arsenal |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_prem/16459110.stm|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=6 February 2012|date=15 January 2012}} On 4 February 2012, he was involved in the build-up for three goals in the 7–1 home victory against [[Blackburn Rovers F.C.|Blackburn Rovers]], setting up two goals for [[Robin van Persie]] and one for [[Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain]].{{cite web |first= Nabil | last= Hassan |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/16779019 |publisher=BBC Sport |title= Arsenal 7–1 Blackburn |accessdate=6 February 2012 |date= 4 February 2012}} On 26 February, Walcott scored two second-half goals against Tottenham Hotspur to help them win 5–2 after being 0–2 down in the [[North London derby]].{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/17093405|title=Arsenal 5–2 Tottenham|publisher=BBC Sport}} On 24 March, Walcott scored Arsenal's second goal in a 3–0 home win over Aston Villa before being substituted by Oxlade-Chamberlain on the 78th minute.{{cite web|last=Ornstein|first=David|title=Arsenal 3–0 Aston Villa|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/17412098|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=17 April 2012|date=24 March 2012}} An injury in a 0–0 draw with Chelsea on 21 April looked set to rule Walcott out for the rest of the season but he was able to return in a substitute appearance on the last day of the season in a 3–2 win for Arsenal over [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]].{{cite web|url=http://m.bbc.com/sport/football/17973141|title=West Bromwich Albion 2–3 Arsenal |publisher=BBC Sport}} ====2012–13 season==== [[File:Flickr - Ronnie Macdonald - Theo Walcott.jpg|thumb|upright|Walcott playing for Arsenal in 2012]] On 15 September 2012, Walcott came on as a substitute for [[Gervinho]] and scored his first goal of the season in a 6–1 win over his former club [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]].{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/19528203|title=Arsenal 6–1 Southampton|publisher=BBC Sport |date=15 September 2012|access-date=16 September 2012}} On 26 September, he scored twice in a 6–1 win against [[Coventry City F.C.|Coventry City]] in the [[2012–13 Football League Cup|League Cup]].[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/19645217 "Arsenal 6–1 Coventry"] BBC Sport. 26 September 2012. Retrieved 26 September 2012. On 7 October 2012 Walcott once again found the back of the net in a 3–1 away victory against [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] to take his number of goals already up to four.{{cite news |title=Arsenal gun down Hammers|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/west-ham-vs-arsenal/261629|publisher=Sky Sports.com}} On 30 October 2012, Walcott scored Arsenal's first goal in first half stoppage time and their fourth goal in second half stoppage time in a League Cup tie at [[Reading F.C.|Reading]] to help the club complete a comeback from 4–0 down to 4–4. Arsenal won 7–5 in extra time, in which Walcott completed his hat-trick and backed up his argument that he should be played as a striker.{{cite web|last=Smith|first=Ben|title=Reading 5–7 Arsenal|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/20053678|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=30 December 2012|date=30 October 2012}} Former Gunner [[Niall Quinn]] praised Walcott's performance as incredible, in what he described as "the most extraordinary game that I've seen."{{cite web|title=Arsenal comeback to beat Reading 7–5 was extraordinary, says Niall Quinn|url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/12379/8214113/Niall-Quinn-says-Arsenal-s-7-5-win-over-Reading-in-the-Capital-One-Cup-is-one-of-the-greatest-games-ever-.|publisher=Sky Sports|accessdate=30 December 2012|date=31 October 2012|quote=From the moment it started to the moment it finished, it was the most extraordinary game that I've seen – possibly since I started in this profession many years ago.}} This took him to five League Cup goals for the season, a total which would make him the top scorer in the 2012–13 competition.{{cite web |title=Divisional Scorers |url=http://www.football-league.co.uk/page/DivisionalScorers/0,,10794~201257,00.html |publisher=The Football League |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130729011844/http://www.football-league.co.uk/page/DivisionalScorers/0%2C%2C10794~201257%2C00.html |archivedate=29 July 2013}} On 6 November, Walcott opened the scoring in the 2–2 draw at [[FC Schalke 04|Schalke 04]] in the [[2012–13 UEFA Champions League|Champions League]].{{cite news |last=Wilson|first=Jeremy|title=Theo Walcott in firing line but makes his point |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/competitions/champions-league/9659115/Theo-Walcott-in-firing-line-but-makes-his-point-as-Arsenal-draw-2-2-against-Schalke-in-Champions-League.html|newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |location=London |accessdate=30 December 2012|date=7 November 2012}} On 17 November, Walcott scored the fifth goal in a repeat of the previous season's 5–2 win over Tottenham.{{cite news|title=Arsenal 5–2 Tottenham| url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/20278355|publisher=BBC Sport|date=17 November 2012 | accessdate =17 November 2012 | last=Ornstein |first=David}} On 29 December, Walcott was deployed as a lone striker and scored his first Premier League hat-trick of the season and provided two assists in an emphatic 7–3 win over [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]].{{cite web|first=David |last= Ornstein |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/20823197|title=Arsenal 7 –3 Newcastle|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=30 December 2012 |date=29 December 2012|quote=Theo Walcott scored three goals and set up two more ...}}{{cite news|last=Kelso|first=Paul|title=Arsenal 7 Newcastle United 3: match report|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/competitions/premier-league/9767432/Arsenal-7-Newcastle-United-3-match-report.html|newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |location=London |accessdate=30 December 2012|date=29 December 2012}} One of Walcott's strikes against Newcastle was voted as the [[BBC Goal of the Month|Goal of the Month]] for November on the BBC's [[Match of the Day]].{{cite web|url=http://www.90min.com/posts/202003-bbc-match-of-the-day-s-goals-of-the-season|title=BBC's Goals of the Season: 2012–13|publisher=90min.com}} [[File:Theo Walcott vs Norwich - 13 April 2013.jpg|thumb|upright|left|Walcott playing for Arsenal in 2013]] On 18 January 2013, Walcott ended speculation about his future when he signed a new three-and-a-half-year contract with Arsenal.{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/21078962|title=Theo Walcott signs new long-term Arsenal contract|date=18 January 2013|accessdate=18 September 2013|publisher=BBC Sport}} Two days later Walcott scored Arsenal's only goal in a 2–1 defeat to Chelsea.[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/21002559 "Chelsea 2–1 Arsenal"]. BBC Sport. 20 January 2013. Retrieved 30 January 2013. This started a run of four successive matches in which he scored, with Walcott also scoring in a 5–1 win against West Ham United on 23 January,[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/21038749 "Arsenal 5–1 West Ham"]. BBC Sport. 23 January 2013. Retrieved 30 January 2013. a 3–2 win against [[Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.|Brighton & Hove Albion]] in the [[2012–13 FA Cup|FA Cup]][https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/21096118 "Brighton 2–3 Arsenal"] BBC Sport. 26 January 2013. Retrieved 30 January 2013. and a 2–2 draw at home to Liverpool.McNulty, Phil (30 January 2013). [https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/21156061 "Arsenal 2–2 Liverpool"] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160113054304/http://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/21156061 |date=13 January 2016 }}. BBC Sport. Retrieved 30 January 2013. He scored the opening goal after just 2 minutes in a 1–1 draw against Manchester United.{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/22237319|title=Arsenal 1–1 Manchester United|publisher=BBC Sport|date=28 April 2013|accessdate=15 May 2013|last=McNulty|first=Phil}} He then scored his 20th goal of the season against Queens Park Rangers after just 20 seconds. The match ended 1–0 and Walcott's goal became the fastest goal of the Premier League that season.{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/22320618|title=QPR 0–1 Arsenal|publisher=BBC Sport|date=4 May 2013|accessdate=15 May 2013|last=Bevan|first=Chris}} Walcott scored another goal in a 4–1 victory over Wigan Athletic which resulted in Wigan's relegation.{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/22430454|title=Arsenal 4–1 Wigan|publisher=BBC Sport|date=14 May 2013|accessdate=15 May 2013|last=McKenna|first=Chris}} Walcott finished the season with 14 goals and 12 assists from 32 Premier League matches and scoring 21 times with 16 assists in all competitions to be Arsenal's top scorer. ====2013–14 season==== [[File:Theo Walcott - FA Cup parade.jpg|thumb|upright|Walcott celebrating with teammates and fans at a parade after winning the [[2013–14 FA Cup]]]] Walcott started the [[2013–14 Arsenal F.C. season|2013–14 campaign]] in good form, registering assists against [[Fenerbahçe S.K. (football)|Fenerbahçe]] in the [[2013–14 UEFA Champions League qualifying phase and play-off round#Play-off round|Champions League play-off round]] as well as against Fulham and Tottenham Hotspur in the Premier League,{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/23691545 |title=Fenerbahce 0–3 Arsenal |first=Mike |last=Henson |publisher=BBC Sport |date=21 August 2013 |accessdate=29 May 2017}}
{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/23744679 |title=Fulham 1–3 Arsenal |first=Owen |last=Phillips |publisher=BBC Sport |date=24 August 2013 |accessdate=29 May 2017}}
{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/23831033 |title=Arsenal 1–0 Tottenham |first=Alistair |last=Magowan |publisher=BBC Sport |date=1 September 2013 |accessdate=6 January 2014}} and scoring against [[Olympique de Marseille]] in the [[2013–14 UEFA Champions League group stage#Group F|Champions League group stage]].{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/24044269 |title=Marseille 1–2 Arsenal |first=Alistair |last=Magowan |publisher=BBC Sport |date=18 September 2013 |accessdate=6 January 2014}} He suffered an abdominal injury in late September that required surgery,{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/24224434 |title=Theo Walcott: Arsenal winger to miss World Cup qualifiers |publisher=BBC Sport |date=24 September 2013 |accessdate=29 May 2017}} and was out of action for two months, returning against his former club Southampton in late November.{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/24968973 |title=Arsenal 2–0 Southampton |first=David |last=Ornstein |publisher=BBC Sport |date=23 November 2013 |accessdate=29 May 2017}} He appeared as a substitute in Arsenal's next four fixtures, assisting goals against [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]] and Everton, and started his first match since returning from injury,{{cite web |url=http://www.thearsenalhistory.com/stat/aftlu.htm |title=Arsenal first team line-ups |first=Andy |last=Kelly |website=The Arsenal History |accessdate=29 May 2017}}{{cite web |url=http://www.arsenal.com/first-team/players/theo-walcott/ |title=Theo Walcott |publisher=Arsenal F.C. |accessdate=22 June 2017}} If necessary, select season required from below "My year" subheading. against [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] on 14 December. He scored twice against City, but could not prevent Arsenal from losing the match 6–3.{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/25275712 |title=Man City 6–3 Arsenal |publisher=BBC Sport |first=Phil |last=McNulty |date=14 December 2013 |accessdate=6 January 2014}} On 26 December, his two goals against West Ham United included the first headed goal of his club career.{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/competitions/premier-league/10537626/West-Ham-United-1-Arsenal-3-match-report.html |title=West Ham United 1 Arsenal 3: match report |first=Matt |last=Law |newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |location=London |date=26 December 2013 |accessdate=29 May 2017}} Walcott injured a knee late in the [[FA Cup]] third-round tie against Tottenham Hotspur at the Emirates Stadium in January 2014. In response to abuse from the area holding the visiting fans while he was being stretchered off, Walcott made a hand gesture that reflected the 2–0 scoreline, and he and the stretcher-bearers were pelted with coins and other missiles thrown from that area. The Football Association "reminded him of his responsibilities", but took no further action.{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2014/jan/05/arsenal-tottenham-fac-cup-match-report |title=Fluent Arsenal revel in Theo Walcott's sign language against Tottenham |first=David |last=Hytner |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London |date=5 January 2014 |accessdate=29 May 2017}}
{{cite news |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/news-and-comment/theo-walcott-ambulance-workers-who-were-pelted-with-coins-while-helping-arsenal-forward-were-9044108.html |title=Theo Walcott: Ambulance workers who were pelted with coins while helping Arsenal forward were Tottenham fans |first=Jack |last=de Menezes |newspaper=The Independent |location=London |date=7 January 2014 |accessdate=29 May 2017}} The injury, a [[Anterior cruciate ligament injury|ruptured anterior cruciate ligament]] of his left knee, meant he was ruled out for at least six months, so would miss the rest of the season and the [[2014 FIFA World Cup]].{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2014/jan/06/theo-walcott-out-for-world-cup-arsenal-england-knee |title=Arsenal's Theo Walcott ruled out for season and World Cup with injury |first=Dominic |last=Fifield |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London |date=7 January 2014 |accessdate=29 May 2017}} ====2014–15 season==== [[File:Arsenal FA Cup Winners Parade (18163649799).jpg|thumb|upright|Walcott (right) at Arsenal's [[2014–15 FA Cup]] winner's parade]] On 1 November 2014, Walcott came off the bench in the 81st minute during a 3–0 [[2014–15 Premier League|Premier League]] home victory against Burnley for his first Gunners appearance in ten months.{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/29768015 |title=Arsenal 3, Burnley 0 |publisher= BBC Sport |date=1 November 2014 |accessdate= 2 November 2014}} He made his first start of the season against [[Hull City A.F.C.|Hull City]] in the third round of the [[2014–15 FA Cup|FA Cup]] on 4 January 2015, exactly a year after sustaining his injury at the same stage of the competition.{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/30614334|title=Arsenal 2–0 Hull|accessdate=26 January 2015|publisher=BBC Sport}} On 25 January, Walcott scored his first goal of [[2014–15 Arsenal F.C. season|2014–15 campaign]] in the second minute of Arsenal's 3–2 FA Cup fourth-round win at [[Brighton & Hove Albion]].{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2015/jan/25/brighton-arsenal-fa-cup-match-report|title=Brighton 2–3 Arsenal|accessdate=26 January 2015|newspaper=The Guardian |location=London}} In February 2015, Walcott scored in successive home league victories. On 1 February 2015, Walcott netted in a 5–0 defeat of Aston Villa,{{cite news | url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/30971833 | title=Arsenal 5–0 Aston Villa| publisher=BBC Sport | date=1 February 2015 | accessdate=9 August 2015}} before scoring what proved to be the winner in a 2–1 win against [[Leicester City F.C.|Leicester City]] nine days later.{{cite news | url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/31106369 | title=Arsenal 2–1 Leicester City | publisher=BBC Sport | date=10 February 2015 | accessdate=9 August 2015}} On 17 May 2015, Walcott's deflected shot, which was registered as a [[Tyler Blackett]] own goal, rescued a point in a 1–1 draw at Manchester United.{{cite news | url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/32679743 | title=Manchester United 1–1 | publisher=BBC Sport | date=17 May 2015 | accessdate=9 August 2015}} One week later, in Arsenal's final match of the Premier League season, Walcott scored a 34-minute hat-trick against West Bromwich Albion at the Emirates Stadium.{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/32770845|title=Arsenal 4–1 West Brom|date=24 May 2015|publisher=BBC Sport}} On 30 May, Walcott was selected to start at centre forward for Arsenal in the [[2015 FA Cup Final]], scoring the opening goal in the team's 4–0 victory against Aston Villa.{{cite news |first=Phil |last=McNulty |title=Arsenal 4–0 Aston Villa |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/32856754 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=30 May 2015 |accessdate=8 December 2017}} ====2015–16 season==== [[File:Theo Walcott 2015.jpg|thumb|upright|Walcott playing for Arsenal in 2015]] Ahead of the new season, it was announced that Walcott had extended his contract with Arsenal after prolonged negotiations.{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/20893347|title=Theo Walcott & Santi Cazorla sign Arsenal contract extensions|date=31 July 2015|publisher=BBC Sport}} Walcott netted twice in pre-season in wins against Everton and [[VfL Wolfsburg|Wolfsburg]], as Arsenal won the [[2015 Premier League Asia Trophy|Premier League Asia Trophy]] and the [[2015 Emirates Cup|Emirates Cup]].{{cite web | url=http://www.arsenal.com/match/report/1415/post/first-team/everton-1-3-Arsenal | title=Everton 1–3 Arsenal | publisher=Arsenal F.C. | date=18 July 2015| accessdate=9 August 2015}}{{cite web | url=http://www.arsenal.com/match/report/1415/post/first-team/arsenal-v-wolfsburg-match-report | title=Arsenal 1–0 Wolfsburg | publisher=Arsenal F.C. | date=26 July 2015 | accessdate=9 August 2015}} He began the [[2015–16 Arsenal F.C. season|2015–16]] season starting at centre forward and assisting Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain's winning goal in the 1–0 defeat of Chelsea in the [[2015 FA Community Shield]] on 2 August 2015.{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/33667216 |title=Arsenal 1–0 Chelsea |first=Andy |last=Cryer |publisher=BBC Sport |date=2 August 2015 |accessdate=8 December 2017}}{{cite web | url=http://www.arsenal.com/match/report/1415/post/first-team/56495/arsenal-v-chelsea-match-report | title=Arsenal 1–0 Chelsea | publisher=Arsenal F.C. | date=2 August 2015 | accessdate=9 August 2015}} On 12 September, Walcott scored his first goal of the season in a 2–0 home victory against Stoke City in the [[2015–16 Premier League]].{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/34160767|title=Arsenal 2–0 Stoke|publisher=BBC Sport|date=12 September 2015}} He netted three more times in September,{{cite news|url=http://www.arsenal.com/news/news-archive/20150930/walcott-is-vitality-player-of-the-month |title=Walcott is Vitality Player of the Month |publisher=Arsenal F.C. |date=30 September 2015}} including the opener in a 5–2 league win at Leicester City{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/34299596|title=Leicester 2–5 Arsenal|publisher=BBC|date=26 September 2015|accessdate=4 October 2015}} and in back-to-back [[2015–16 UEFA Champions League|UEFA Champions League]] defeats to Dinamo Zagreb and Olympiacos, the latter of which he picked up an assist for an [[Alexis Sánchez]] header.{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/34203643|title=Dinamo Zagreb 2–1 Arsenal|publisher=BBC|date=16 September 2015|accessdate=4 October 2015}}{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/34382802|title=Arsenal 2–3 Olympiakos|publisher=BBC|date=29 September 2015|accessdate=4 October 2015}} His performances saw him voted Arsenal Supporters' Player of the Month for September. He registered another two assists in a 3–0 home league win over Manchester United on 4 October.{{cite web | url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/34372498 | title=Arsenal 3–0 Man Utd | publisher=BBC | date=4 October 2015 | accessdate=22 December 2015}} On 21 December, Walcott opened the scoring in a 2–1 league defeat of Manchester City at The Emirates.{{cite news | url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/35089795|title=Arsenal 2–1 Manchester City|date=21 December 2015}} On 8 March, Walcott scored a brace in a 4–0 away victory over Hull City in a [[2015–16 FA Cup|FA Cup replay]]{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/35693501|title=Hull City 0–4 Arsenal|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=11 March 2016}}{{cite web|url=http://espn.go.com/blog/the-match/60/post/2824667/arsenal-strikers-end-drought-in-welcomed-fa-cup-win-at-hull|title=Jolly: Welcome win for Arsenal at Hull|publisher=ESPN |accessdate=11 March 2016}} ====2016–17 season==== Walcott started Arsenal's opening match against Liverpool, in which he missed a penalty after being brought down by [[Alberto Moreno]], however, he made-up for his earlier miss by scoring Arsenal's opener, however Arsenal still lost the match 3–4.{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/37001073|first= Saj |last=Chowdhury |title=Arsenal 3–4 Liverpool |publisher=BBC Sport|date=14 August 2016 |accessdate=24 September 2016}} Walcott scored his second goal of the season and his 100th career goal after linking up with [[Alex Iwobi]] to chip the ball over Hull City goalkeeper [[Eldin Jakupović]] to score Arsenal's second goal in a 4–1 win.{{cite web|first=Josh| last=James| url=http://www.arsenal.com/match/report/1617/post/first-team/hull-city-v-arsenal-report |title=Hull City 1–4 Arsenal |publisher=Arsenal F.C. |date=17 September 2016 |accessdate=24 September 2016}}{{cite web|last=Abraham |first=Timothy |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/37326798 |title=Hull City 1–4 Arsenal |publisher=BBC Sport |date=17 September 2016 |accessdate=24 September 2016}} He then netted his first [[2016–17 UEFA Champions League|Champions League]] goals of the season with a brace in a 2–0 win over [[FC Basel|Basel]] on 30 September.{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2016/sep/28/arsenal-basel-champions-league-match-report|title=Theo Walcott at the double in comfortable Arsenal win against Basel|last=Fifield|first=Dominic|date=28 September 2016|newspaper=The Guardian |location=London |accessdate=30 September 2016}} On 17 December 2016, Walcott scored the opening goal of a 2–1 loss at Manchester City before being substituted with a calf injury.{{cite news|url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/theo-walcott-returns-arsenal-ahead-9703688|title=Theo Walcott returns for Arsenal ahead of FA Cup fourth round tie against former club Southampton|date=27 January 2017|newspaper=Daily Mirror |location=London}} He returned on 28 January 2017, scoring a hat-trick against former club Southampton in the fourth round of the [[2016–17 FA Cup|FA Cup]] at [[St. Mary's Stadium]].{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2017/jan/28/southampton-arsenal-fa-cup-match-report|title=Arsenal's Danny Welbeck and Theo Walcott run riot against Southampton|date=29 January 2017|newspaper=The Guardian |location=London}} He scored his 100th goal for Arsenal on 20 February in the next round of the FA Cup in a 2–0 victory over [[Sutton United F.C.|Sutton United]].{{cite news|first1=Jason|last1=Burt|first2=Rob|last2=Bagchi|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2017/02/20/sutton-united-vs-arsenal-fa-cup-live-score/|title=Sutton United 0 Arsenal 2: Theo Walcott brings up his century to set up quarter-final against Lincoln City|newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |location=London |date=20 February 2017|accessdate=1 March 2017}} On 5 April, Walcott captained Arsenal to a 3–0 win in their league match at The Emirates against London rivals West Ham United; he scored the second goal,{{cite web|last1=Begley|first1=Emlyn|title=Arsenal 3–0 West Ham United|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/39426761|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=6 April 2017|date=5 April 2017}} which was his 19th and last of the season and took his total to 104. He was an unused substitute as Arsenal beat Chelsea 2–1 in the [[2017 FA Cup Final]].{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/39984089 |title=Arsenal 2–1 Chelsea |first=Phil |last=McNulty |publisher=BBC Sport |date=27 May 2017 |accessdate=8 December 2017}} ====2017–18 season==== With the scores tied at 1–1 after normal time, Walcott converted his kick as Arsenal beat Chelsea 4–1 on penalties to win the [[2017 FA Community Shield|2017 Community Shield]],{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40766983 |title=Arsenal 1–1 Chelsea |first=Tom |last=Rostance |publisher=BBC Sport |date=6 August 2017 |accessdate=8 December 2017}} but throughout his last season at Arsenal, he was mainly used in the [[Europa League]] and in the [[EFL Cup]], and he only made 6 substitute appearances in the Premier League. By October, he was increasingly on the fringes at Arsenal,{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2017/10/20/theo-walcott-confident-can-work-way-back-englands-world-cupteam/ |title=Theo Walcott confident he can work way back into England's World Cup team |first=Sam |last=Dean |newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |location=London |date=20 October 2017 |accessdate=17 November 2017}} and was criticised following a poor performance when made captain in a 2–1 League Cup victory at home to Championship side [[Norwich City F.C.|Norwich City]].{{cite news |url=http://www.espn.co.uk/football/club/arsenal/359/blog/post/3242666/supersub-eddie-nketiah-starsjack-wilshere-gets-7-10-as-arsenal-avoid-norwich-slip |title=Eddie Nketiah stars, Jack Wilshere gets 7/10 as Arsenal avoid Norwich slip |first=James |last=McNicholas |publisher=ESPN |date=24 October 2017 |accessdate=17 November 2017}} with Arsenal's second highest goalscorer [[Ian Wright]] suggesting that for Walcott's own good, he needed to leave the club,{{cite news |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11670/11097474/theo-walcott-should-leave-arsenal-says-ian-wright-on-the-debate |title=Theo Walcott should leave Arsenal, says Ian Wright on The Debate |publisher=Sky Sports |date=25 October 2017 |accessdate=17 November 2017}} a view with which Wenger disagreed.{{cite news |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11670/11099424/theo-walcott-still-wanted-at-arsenal-says-arsene-wenger |title=Theo Walcott still wanted at Arsenal, says Arsene Wenger |first=James |last=Dale |publisher=Sky Sports |date=26 October 2017 |accessdate=17 November 2017}} Walcott did score 4 goals during his last season at the club, against [[Doncaster Rovers]] in the League Cup {{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/41249728|title=Arsenal 1–0 Doncaster Rovers|date=20 September 2017|publisher=BBC Sport}}, and 3 in the [[2017–18_UEFA_Europa_League_group_stage#Group_H|Europa League group stage]], all coming against [[BATE Borisov]], with 2 away{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuropaleague/season=2018/matches/round=2000890/match=2022053/index.html#/|title=UEFA Europa League – BATE-Arsenal|first=|last=UEFA.com|website=UEFA.com}}, and 1 at home{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuropaleague/season=2018/matches/round=2000890/match=2022149/index.html#/|title=UEFA Europa League – Arsenal-BATE|first=|last=UEFA.com|website=UEFA.com}}. ===Everton=== On 17 January 2018, Walcott signed a three-and-a-half-year contract with Everton in what the BBC reported as "a deal worth more than £20m".{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/42715223 |title=Theo Walcott: Everton sign forward from Arsenal |first=David |last=Ornstein |publisher=BBC Sport |date=17 January 2018 |accessdate=26 January 2018}} He made his debut for the club three days later, providing the assist for [[Oumar Niasse]]'s equaliser in a 1–1 draw at home to West Bromwich Albion in the Premier League.{{Cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2018/jan/20/everton-west-brom-premier-league-report |title=Oumar Niasse's volley earns draw for listless Everton against West Brom |first=Nick |last=Ames |newspaper=The Observer |location=London |date=20 January 2018 |accessdate=26 January 2018}} He then recorded a [[2 (number)#In sports|brace]] in his next match, a 2–1 win over Leicester.{{cite news |title=Theo Walcott ends Everton's winless run with double against Leicester |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2018/jan/31/everton-leicester-premier-league-match-report |accessdate=2 February 2018 |newspaper=The Guardian |date=31 Jan 2018}} ==International career== ===2006 World Cup=== On 8 May 2006, Walcott was surprisingly named in [[Sven-Göran Eriksson]]'s [[2006 FIFA World Cup squads#England|squad]] for the [[2006 FIFA World Cup]],{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/world_cup_2006/teams/england/4983618.stm|title=Walcott & Lennon in England squad|date=8 May 2006|accessdate=15 August 2013|publisher=BBC Sport}} despite having only made 13 appearances in senior football and making none since joining [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]].{{cite news|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-385548/Theo-Walcott-Ten-things-didnt-know.html|title=Theo Walcott: Ten things you didn't know|date=9 May 2006|accessdate=15 August 2013|newspaper=Daily Mail |location=London}}{{Unreliable source?|date=April 2017}} Even with first-choice strikers [[Wayne Rooney]] and Michael Owen both recovering from injury, Walcott was selected over established Premier League strikers [[Darren Bent]] (the highest-scoring English forward in the Premier League in the [[2005–06 Premier League|2005–06 season]]), [[Andrew Johnson (English footballer)|Andrew Johnson]] (the top English goalscorer in the Premier League in the [[2004–05 Premier League|2004–05 season]]), [[Dean Ashton]] (like Bent, already an established player at [[England national under-21 football team|England Under-21]] level) and [[Jermain Defoe]]. On 25 May 2006, Walcott came on as a second-half substitute for the [[England national football B team|England B]] team against [[Belarus national football team|Belarus]].{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/world_cup_2006/teams/england/5017924.stm |title=England B 1–2 Belarus |publisher=BBC Sport |date=25 May 2006 |accessdate=27 November 2017}} On 30 May 2006, he became [[England national football team records|England's youngest ever senior player]] by appearing in a 3–1 [[Exhibition game#Association football|friendly]] win over [[Hungary national football team|Hungary]] at [[Old Trafford]] aged 17 years and 75 days. Despite being one of only two fully fit strikers in the England squad (the other being [[Peter Crouch]]), he did not play during the tournament. Eriksson defended his decision, claiming that the experience would serve Walcott well for future tournaments.{{cite news | date=2 July 2006| url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/world_cup_2006/teams/england/5139428.stm | title=Eriksson defends Walcott choice |publisher=BBC Sport | accessdate=7 July 2006 | first=Phil | last=McNulty}} After the World Cup, Eriksson stepped down as England manager. New appointment [[Steve McClaren]] put Walcott into the England Under-21s, claiming he was "toughening up" on his squad selections. ===2007 and 2009 Under-21 European Championships=== On 15 August 2006, Walcott became the youngest player ever to score for the [[England national under-21 football team|England under-21 team]] when he scored the opener after three minutes in England's 2–2 draw with [[Moldova national under-21 football team|Moldova]] at Ipswich Town's ground [[Portman Road]]. The match against Moldova was his first cap for the England under-21s.{{cite news| url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/gossip_and_transfers/4778613.stm |publisher=BBC Sport | title=Thursday's gossip column | date=10 August 2006 | accessdate=25 May 2010}} Walcott scored two goals against [[Germany national under-21 football team|Germany]] to seal qualification for England to the [[2007 UEFA European Under-21 Championship|Under-21 European Championship]], in the playoff second leg in October 2006, with his second drawing comparisons with Thierry Henry.{{cite news|url=http://www.timesonline.co.uk/article/0,,30849-2398754,00.html |date=11 October 2006|title=Wizardry of Walcott puts Germany under a spell |newspaper=The Times |accessdate=8 December 2006 | location=London | first=Peter | last=Lansley}} Over the summer of 2009, Walcott participated in England under-21 team's [[2009 UEFA European Under-21 Championship]] campaign despite protestations from his club manager, Arsène Wenger. Wenger complained that Walcott's participation in the tournament as well as matches with the senior squad would lead to burn out and injury.{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/a/arsenal/8067214.stm |title= Wenger fear over Walcott workload |publisher=BBC Sport |date=25 May 2009 }} England reached the final of the U21 Euros, where they lost 4–0 to Germany, with Walcott thus earning a silver medal as a runner-up.{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/england/5690126/England-U21-0-Germany-U21-4-match-report.html |title=England U21 0 Germany U21 4: Match report |first=Henry |last=Winter |newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |location=London |date=29 June 2009 |accessdate=23 December 2017}} ===2010 World Cup Qualification and omission from Finals=== On 6 September 2008, Walcott made his first competitive start in a World Cup qualifier against [[Andorra national football team|Andorra]],{{cite web|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-1052695/Capello-wields-axe-Becks-Walcott-set-England-start-Andorra.html|title=Capello wields axe on Becks: Walcott set for England start|newspaper=Daily Mail |location=London}}{{Unreliable source?|date=April 2017}} and in the following match against [[Croatia national football team|Croatia]] on 10 September he opened his senior international goals tally and became the youngest player in history to score a hat-trick for England. In doing so, Walcott also became the first England player to score a hat-trick in a competitive match since Michael Owen in 2001.{{cite news |first=Jonathan |last=Stevenson |title=Croatia 1–4 England |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/internationals/7602774.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=10 September 2008 |accessdate=15 June 2016}} Walcott returned to the international fold on 3 March 2010 in a friendly against [[Egypt national football team|Egypt]]. It was his first international start for nine months.{{cite news |url=http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/sport/football/article7049298.ece |title=Theo Walcott does not understand football, says Chris Waddle |author=Smith, Ben |date=4 March 2010 |newspaper=The Times |accessdate=30 May 2010 |location=London}} He faded after a bright start{{cite news |url=http://soccernet.espn.go.com/world-cup/story/_/id/750456/ce/uk/?campaign=rss&source=soccernet&cc=4716&ver=global |title=Waddle unimpressed with Walcott |date=4 March 2010 |publisher=ESPN Soccernet |accessdate=30 May 2010}} and was replaced by [[Shaun Wright-Phillips]] after 57 minutes as England recovered from a goal down to beat Egypt 3–1 at [[Wembley Stadium]]. His performance came under heavy criticism from [[Chris Waddle]] who said of Walcott, "I've never seen him develop. He just doesn't understand the game for me – where to be running, when to run inside a full back, when to just play a one-two. It's all off the cuff. I just don't think he's got a football brain and he's going to have problems. Let's be honest, good defenders would catch him offside every time." Walcott started England's friendly victories against Mexico and [[Japan national football team|Japan]] in May 2010.{{cite web|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/world_cup_2010/8699042.stm|title=England 3–1 Mexico|publisher=BBC Sport}}{{cite web|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/world_cup_2010/8712673.stm|title=Japan 1–2 England|publisher=BBC Sport}} However, on 1 June 2010, it was announced that Walcott had been left out of England's 23-man World Cup squad by [[Fabio Capello]].{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/world_cup_2010/8713742.stm |title=World Cup 2010: Walcott left out of England squad |date=1 June 2010 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=1 June 2010}} On 4 July, a few days after England's exit from the World Cup, [[Lionel Messi]] said that he was shocked by Walcott's exclusion as he believed that Walcott could have made the difference against Germany and [[Algeria national football team|Algeria]].{{cite news |url= http://soccernet.espn.go.com/world-cup/story/_/id/805925/ce/uk/?cc=4716&ver=global |title=World Cup 2010: Messi shocked by Walcott's axe |date=4 July 2010 |publisher=ESPNsoccernet |accessdate=4 July 2010}} In January 2011, Capello admitted that he had made a mistake in not selecting Walcott for the 2010 World Cup.{{cite news |url= https://www.thetimes.co.uk/article/i-should-have-taken-theo-walcott-to-the-world-cup-admits-fabio-capello-vdppp2t65zc|title=I should have taken Theo Walcott to World Cup, admits Fabio Capello|date=28 January 2011|first=Oliver|last=Kay|newspaper= The Times|location=London}} ===Euro 2012=== In the [[UEFA Euro 2012 qualifying|Euro 2012 qualifying]] match against [[Switzerland national football team|Switzerland]] on 7 September 2010, Walcott was stretchered off after he was clipped in the build-up to Wayne Rooney's opener for England after 10 minutes{{cite news|title= England winger Theo Walcott has X-ray on ankle injury|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/8978359.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=8 September 2010|date=7 September 2010}} putting him out of action for several weeks.{{cite web |url=http://origin-www.premierleague.com/page/Headlines/0,,12306~2148973,00.html |title=Walcott blow for Gunners |date=9 September 2010 |publisher=Premier League |accessdate=22 February 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140226184512/http://origin-www.premierleague.com/page/Headlines/0,,12306~2148973,00.html |archivedate=26 February 2014 |df=dmy-all }} At [[UEFA Euro 2012]], Walcott appeared for England as a second-half substitute in the group match against [[Sweden national football team|Sweden]]. Shortly after coming on, Walcott scored to bring the match level at 2–2. Less than 15 minutes later, he provided the cross for [[Danny Welbeck]]'s 74th-minute winner in England's 3–2 victory.{{cite news |first=Phil |last=McNulty |title=Sweden 2–3 England |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/18181790 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=15 June 2012 |accessdate=15 June 2016}} Afterwards, England manager Roy Hodgson praised Walcott's "enormous" impact on the match, while [[Lee Dixon]] on the BBC said Walcott had "changed the game".{{cite news|title=Euro 2012: Walcott's impact was 'enormous' – Roy Hodgson|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/18467617|publisher=BBC Sport|date=16 June 2012}}{{cite news|title=Euro 2012-day eight analysis: How Walcott saved England|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/18462729|publisher=BBC Sport|date=15 June 2012}} Walcott also played in the final group match against [[Ukraine national football team|Ukraine]] which England won 1–0.{{cite news| first= Phil | last= McNulty |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/18181971|title=England 1–0 Ukraine|publisher=BBC Sport|date=19 June 2012|accessdate=30 October 2016}} ===2014 World Cup Qualifying=== Walcott started in England's 5–0 win against [[San Marino national football team|San Marino]], but was injured in an early clash with the goalkeeper [[Aldo Junior Simoncini|Aldo Simoncini]]. After treatment on the touchline, he was substituted for [[Aaron Lennon]], and then taken to hospital as a precaution, where he underwent "scans and tests" according to England manager [[Roy Hodgson]],{{cite news|last=Paul|first=Kelso|title=England v San Marino: Roy Hodgson fumes as Theo Walcott is cut down by goalkeeper's reckless tackle |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/england/9606149/England-v-San-Marino-Roy-Hodgson-fumes-as-Theo-Walcott-is-cut-down-by-goalkeepers-reckless-tackle.html |newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |location=London |accessdate=17 October 2012|date=12 October 2012}} Walcott was later ruled out of England's next match against [[Poland national football team|Poland]], he did not start a match in the [[2014 FIFA World Cup qualification|qualifiers]] until almost a year later on 6 September, when he played the full 90 minutes in the 4–0 win against [[Moldova national football team|Moldova]], he also played 87 minutes in the following match against Ukraine, which ended in a 0–0 draw, but he was injured before England's match against [[Montenegro national football team|Montenegro]] and he was still out against Poland, which England won 2–0 to qualify for the 2014 FIFA World Cup, in Brazil.{{citation needed|date=April 2017}} ===Euro 2016 omission and World Cup 2018 qualifying=== Having missed out on the 2014 World Cup through injury, Walcott was not selected by Roy Hodgson for the 26-man provisional [[Euro 2016]] squad announced in May 2016. Hodgson commented, "Theo unfortunately has not got such a regular match over the last few months and has had a few problems with injury. It's a tough decision but it's one you have to take."{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2016/may/16/england-euro-2016-squad-marcus-rashford-jack-wilshere-andros-townsend-jordan-henderson|title=Marcus Rashford and Andros Townsend in provisional England Euro 2016 squad|last=Nakrani|first=Sachin|date=16 May 2016|newspaper=The Guardian |location=London |accessdate=17 March 2017}} Walcott was informed by England manager [[Gareth Southgate]] on 16 March 2017, his 28th birthday, that he was being dropped from the squad to play a friendly against Germany and a [[2018 FIFA World Cup]] qualifier against [[Lithuania national football team|Lithuania]], despite scoring 17 goals in 29 appearances in all club competitions during the 2016–17 season.{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2017/mar/16/theo-walcott-dropped-gareth-southgate-england|title=Happy birthday, Theo, you're dropped – England bombshell for Walcott|date=16 March 2017|newspaper=The Guardian |location=London |accessdate=17 March 2017}} Southgate said that Walcott had not transferred his early season form into the England matches against [[Malta national football team|Malta]] and [[Slovenia national football team|Slovenia]] in October 2016 and [[Spain national football team|Spain]] in November 2016. ==Style of play== Walcott is well known for his rapid pace,{{cite news | date=23 December 2009| url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/theo-walcott-shatters-thierry-henrys-3368956|first=John |last=Cross| title=Theo Walcott shatters Thierry Henry's Arsenal record| newspaper=Daily Mirror |location=London |accessdate=26 August 2011}} with former Barcelona manager Pep Guardiola declaring that "you would need a pistol to stop him."{{cite news | date=6 April 2010| url=http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/sport/football/premier_league/arsenal/article7088349.ece|first=Oliver |last=Kay| title=Theo Walcott's pace plants seed of uncertainty in Barcelona's minds| newspaper=The Times |location=London | accessdate=29 January 2011}} He has been likened by Arsenal manager Arsène Wenger to the club's all-time leading scorer, Thierry Henry.{{cite news | date=3 November 2010| url=http://www.espn.co.uk/football/sport/story/54165.html| title=Wenger expects Walcott to emulate Henry | publisher=ESPN UK | accessdate=29 January 2011}} [[FIFA World Player of the Year]] winner Lionel Messi has described Walcott as "one of the most dangerous players I have ever played against."{{cite news |url= http://soccernet.espn.go.com/world-cup/story/_/id/805925/ce/uk/?cc=4716&ver=global |title=World Cup 2010: Messi shocked by Walcott's axe |date=4 July 2010 |publisher=ESPN Soccernet |accessdate=29 January 2011}} In addition to his speed, Walcott also possesses good balance, movement and technique.{{cite web|last=Marcotti|first=Gabriele|title=Arsenal misread situation with Walcott|url=http://soccernet.espn.go.com/feature/_/id/1145547/marcotti:-arsenal-misread-situation-with-walcott-?cc=5901|work=Sports Illustrated|accessdate=29 August 2012}} ==Outside football== [[File:David Yates New York 2010.jpg|thumb|upright|Theo's aunt Yvonne Walcott with her husband [[David Yates]]]] ===Personal life=== His family made a cameo appearance in the 2007 film ''[[Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix (film)|Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix]]'', directed by [[David Yates]], the partner of Walcott's aunt.{{cite web|url=http://www.snitchseeker.com/harry-potter-news/actress-melanie-slade-talks-filming-half-blood-prince-updated-62536/|title=Actress Melanie Slade talks filming Half-Blood Prince |publisher=snitchseeker.com|date=27 February 2009| accessdate=8 March 2017}}{{cite news |first=Henry|last=Deedes |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/people/pandora/pandora-standard-opera-row-has-a-dramatic-finish-1633413.html|title=Pandora: 'Standard' opera row has a dramatic finish|newspaper=The Independent |location=London |date=27 February 2009 |accessdate=8 March 2017}} Walcott himself was due to appear as well, but his commitments to Arsenal forced him to drop out.{{cite news|url=http://www.timesonline.co.uk/article/0,,2093-2372152,00.html|date=24 September 2006|title=Football Shorts: Theo misses out on Harry Potter film|newspaper=The Times|accessdate=24 October 2006 | location=London|first=Fiona|last=Hamilton}} His cousin [[Jacob Walcott]] was a trainee at Reading{{cite web|url=http://www.thefa.com/England/Mens-u16s/news/2009/jacobwalcott |date=29 November 2007|title=Following in Theo's footsteps |publisher=The Football Association |accessdate=22 February 2014|first=Russell|last= Staves}} and a member of the [[England national under-17 football team]] appearing in the [[2009 UEFA European Under-17 Championship]].{{cite web|url=http://sv.cd.uefa.com/under17/season=2009/matches/round=15207/match=2001160/index.html |date=6 May 2009 |title=Garbutt hits back as England hold Dutch |publisher=UEFA |accessdate=22 February 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140301184158/http://sv.cd.uefa.com/under17/season=2009/matches/round=15207/match=2001160/index.html |archivedate=1 March 2014 }} His older sister, Hollie, is a bodybuilder who came second in the British Natural Bodybuilding Federation Central Championships in July 2010.{{cite news|url=http://metro.co.uk/2010/08/09/theos-sister-hollie-walcott-in-uk-bodybuilder-championships-473787/|newspaper=Metro|location=London |title=Hollie Walcott|date=9 August 2010}} Walcott has been in a long-term relationship with Melanie Slade, after meeting in 2004 at the [[WestQuay]] shopping centre in Southampton.{{cite news|first=
