Carole|last=Cadwalladr|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2006/jun/04/worldcup2006.sport37 |date= 4 June 2006 |title=Meet the real footballers' wives |newspaper=The Guardian |accessdate=27 March 2009 | location=London}} The couple married at the [[Castello di Vincigliata]] in Tuscany, Italy, in June 2013.{{cite news |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-2347083/Arsenal-star-Theo-Walcott-ties-knot-childhood-sweetheart-Melanie-Slade.html|title=Theo Walcott ties the knot with childhood sweetheart Melanie Slade|newspaper=Daily Mail |location=London |date=24 June 2013|accessdate=24 June 2013}}{{Unreliable source?|date=April 2017}} Their first son Finley James Walcott was born on 10 April 2014,{{cite news |title=Theo Walcott shows off handsome newborn son in first photo |url=http://www.hellomagazine.com/healthandbeauty/mother-and-baby/2014041318164/theo-walcott-baby-photo-melanie-slade/ |magazine=Hello! |accessdate=14 April 2014|date=13 April 2014}} with their second son, Arlo, being born on 26 November 2016.{{cite news |last1=Bhardwaj|first1=Vaishali|title=Arsenal star Theo Walcott becomes father for second time after welcoming second boy into the world |url=https://www.standard.co.uk/sport/football/arsenal-star-theo-walcott-becomes-father-for-second-time-after-welcoming-second-boy-into-the-world-a3405656.html|accessdate=27 November 2016 |newspaper=London Evening Standard|date=26 November 2016}} Walcott has been involved with the UK charities Build a School{{cite news | title= Charity celebrates year of success | newspaper=Harrow Times |author=Kirk, Tristan | url= http://www.harrowtimes.co.uk/display.var.1773429.0.0.php|date = 21 October 2007|accessdate=11 September 2008}} and Best Beginnings.{{cite web | title= Fundraising film |publisher=YouTube | url= https://www.youtube.com/bbshorts|date = May 2009|accessdate=27 May 2009}} He also has a pie named in his honour at the Arsenal pie shop in [[Holloway, London|Holloway]], which won a gold award at the British Pie Awards of 2015.{{cite news|first=Rory|last= Brigstock-Barron |url=http://www.islingtongazette.co.uk/news/walcott_on_the_menu_at_famous_arsenal_pie_shop_in_holloway_1_4058624|title=Walcott on the menu at famous Arsenal pie shop in Holloway|newspaper=Islington Gazette |location=London |date=3 May 2015|accessdate=8 March 2017}} On 6 April 2008, Walcott was a torchbearer for the [[Olympic Flame]] for [[Beijing 2008]] as it was paraded around London. He was the penultimate torchbearer just before [[Kelly Holmes|Dame Kelly Holmes]].{{cite news|url=https://www.standard.co.uk/goingout/attractions/where-to-see-the-olympic-torch-in-london-7247139.html|title=Where to see the Olympic torch in London|newspaper=Evening Standard |location=London |date=3 April 2008|accessdate=8 March 2017}}{{cite news |url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/london/content/articles/2008/03/04/olympic_torch_feature.shtml|title=Olympic Torch Relay in London|publisher=BBC Sport |date=3 April 2008|accessdate=8 March 2017}}{{cite web|url=http://www.supersport.com/football/football-features/news/100824/EPL_Player_of_the_Week_Walcott|title=EPL Player of the Week-Walcott|publisher=Super Sport.com|date=24 August 2010|accessdate=8 March 2017}} ===Endorsements=== When Walcott was 14 years old, he signed an endorsement deal with American sportswear and equipment supplier, Nike. In November 2012 he appeared in an advert for the new Nike Green Speed II alongside [[Eden Hazard]] and [[Raheem Sterling]].{{cite news | url = http://www.footballboots.co.uk/7958-theo-walcott-nike-gs-2.html | title = Theo Walcott Wears the Nike GS2 | publisher = Football Boots |date=23 November 2012| accessdate = 26 November 2012 }} In February 2015, Walcott announced a new sponsorship deal with [[Adidas]].{{cite web|url=http://www.footyheadlines.com/2015/02/theo-walcott-joins-adidas.html|title=Theo Walcott joins Adidas|website=Footy Headlines.com|date=20 February 2015|accessdate=9 February 2017}} Walcott appeared in an advert for Adidas in August 2016, showing off his skills in dribbling and flicking a ball into the open top of a wheelie bin.{{cite news |url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/theo-walcott-scores-bin-adidas-8541776|first =Mick|last=Gadd|title=Theo Walcott scores in a bin for adidas but still chasing first Arsenal goal of the pre-season|newspaper=Daily Mirror |location=London |date=1 August 2016 |accessdate=9 February 2017}} Walcott features in EA Sports' [[FIFA (video game series)|''FIFA'']] video game series. One of his [[goal celebration]]s – ‘pat-a-cake’ dance with [[Mesut Özil]] – appears in ''[[FIFA 14]]''.[https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/fifa-14-celebrations-how-gareth-2268393 "Fifa 14 celebrations: How to do Gareth Bale, Ronaldo, and Lionel Messi's signature moves"]. ''The Mirror''. Retrieved September 6, 2014{{cite news |title=The Evolution of EA Sport's FIFA 14 Video Game |url=https://abcnews.go.com/ABC_Univision/ABC_Univision/evolution-ea-sports-fifa-14-video-game/story?id=20028621 |accessdate=29 September 2018 |agency=ABC News}} ===Books=== Walcott currently has four published books – "''T.J. and the Hat-Trick''", "''T.J. and the Penalty''", "''T.J. and the Winning Goal''" and "''T.J. and the Cup Run''". The first two were published in April 2010, with the latter two being published in August 2010. All four were published by [[Corgi Books|Corgi Children's]].{{cite web|title=Theo Walcott Bibliography |url=https://www.amazon.co.uk/s?url=search-alias%3Daps&field-keywords=theo+walcott&sprefix=theo+walcott |publisher=Amazon.com|accessdate=17 August 2011}} In August 2011, Walcott's autobiography ''Theo: Growing Up Fast'' was published by [[Bantam Press]].{{cite book |last=Walcott |first=Theo |title=Theo: Growing Up Fast |year=2011 |publisher=Bantam Press |isbn=0-593-06459-3 |url=https://www.amazon.co.uk/dp/0593064593}} The book caused controversy because of his criticism of England manager Fabio Capello, whom he describes as "cold and clinical".{{cite news|last=Fifield|first=Dominic|title=Theo Walcott criticises Fabio Capello's World Cup preparations in book|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2011/aug/15/walcott-criticises-capello-book|newspaper=The Guardian |location=London |accessdate=17 August 2011|date=15 August 2011}} ==Career statistics==
